transportAdvice: Aarhus is a compact and walkable city, with most major attractions reachable on foot in the city centre. A light rail line and an extensive bus network cover the wider city and tourist areas, and taxis are readily available throughout.

weather.description: Cold and grey with occasional frost, short daylight hours, and a damp chill that calls for warm layers.
Still wintry and overcast, with cold winds off the sea and occasional sleet or light snow.
Early signs of spring with slowly lengthening days, though temperatures remain cool and rain is common.
Mild and increasingly pleasant, with fresh breezes and occasional sunny spells as the city comes to life.
One of the most enjoyable months, with warm days, blooming parks, and long evenings ideal for exploring.
Warm and bright with very long daylight hours, making it a great time to enjoy outdoor cafes and the waterfront.
The warmest month of the year, with comfortable temperatures and lively outdoor festivals and events.
Still warm and summery with long days, though occasional showers can appear toward the end of the month.
A pleasant early autumn with cooling temperatures, golden light, and fewer crowds than peak summer.
Noticeably cooler and wetter, with autumn colours in the parks and shorter, often overcast days.
Cold and damp with limited daylight, though the city's cosy indoor culture and Christmas markets begin to emerge.
Dark and cold with festive Christmas atmosphere, occasional frost, and the charm of seasonal markets and warm interiors.
